DataElement.preferredName: Neuroblastoma First Specimen Recurrent Disease Necrotic Change Percentage Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value to represent the percentage of cell death in a malignant tumor sample or specimen for the first relapse tissue.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Neuroblastoma First Specimen Recurrent Disease Necrotic Change
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A neuroblastic tumor characterized by the presence of neuroblastic cells, the absence of ganglion cells, and the absence of a prominent Schwannian stroma formation._Preceding all others in time or space or degree._A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis._The return of a disease after a period of remission._A finding indicating the presence of cellular necrosis in a tissue specimen.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Neuroblastoma is a specific type of neuroblastic tumor which is characterized by the presense of neuroblastic cells forming groups or nests separated by delicate stromal septa without prominent Schwannian stroma. (Adapted from WHO.)

Concepts.definition: A malignant neuroblastic tumor characterized by the presence of neuroblastic cells, the absence of ganglion cells, and the absence of a prominent Schwannian stroma formation.

Property.preferredName: First Specimen Recurrent Disease Necrotic Change
Property.preferredDefinition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.:A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.:The return of a disease after a period of remission.:A finding indicating the presence of cellular necrosis in a tissue specimen.

Concepts.definition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.
The return of a disease after a period of remission.
A finding indicating the presence of cellular necrosis in a tissue specimen.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for TARGET harmonization project per request by T.Davidsen. mc 12/1/2014

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
